channel.title: Hub of Hubs on
channel.description: Recent content in Hub of Hubs on

item.title: Artificial Intelligence
item.description: One of my favorite topics to learn about. The whole concept of machines using the human development of knowledge creates a wonderful connection between biology and technology, 2 unalike fields.

item.title: Auto Encoders
item.description: An important, iconic system in AI classification that involves sending an input through some sort of conversion/encryption tool, then decrypting the result to match the original input as close as possible.

item.title: Binary Classification
item.description: Algorithm where output is either 0 or 1 (could symbolize true/false, yes/no). Example We got a 64x64 pixel cat picture. Input is picture, output is either 1 (cat) or 0 (no cat) In order to make this more processable for the algorithm, we break the picture into 3 matrices of pixel values for each Red, Green, and Blue pixel.

item.title: Deep Learning
item.description: Representations in terms of more representations (inception type vibe). Often refers to training Neural Networks. Examples Say you took a selfie, and we wanted an AI to find you in the picture.

item.title: Logistic Regression
item.description: Text description (ü§Æ) An algorithm for Binary classification in Supervised Learning. In statistics terms, it estimates the probability of an event happening or not, like if you vote or didn’t vote, given a dataset.

item.title: Machine Learning
item.description: Performance of model ‚àù Representation of data Examples A system that decides the salary of employees Would use database with features of employees (hours worked, company title, number of people managed) and their corresponding salaries to create a model Then uses model to assign salaries to future employees Bad data (where datapoints do not correlate to features) gives bad results Logistic Regression: Uses dataset to create mathematical correlations between features and outcomes TLDR: Use good features for good results

item.title: Neural Networks
item.description: Explanation At its most basic form, a neural network is just a series of nodes that are connected together, inspired by how neurons work in humans.

item.title: Representation Learning
item.description: Method that uses a set of techniques to let the system automatically find features needed for Machine Learning. Example: Auto Encoders

item.title: Supervised Learning
item.description: Definition: It’s a learning function that maps an input to an output using example input-output pairs. Examples Lots of money in this field comes from online advertising (ew).
